attention1.ptxt: When servicing fuel system, be sure to observe WARNING in Precautions on Fuel System Service:For Diesel Engine Model to reduce the risk of fire and personal injury.

servinfosub.title: Procedure for checking for an external leak on the fuel circuit:
servinfosub.ptxt: Clean away traces of grease with clean thinner and wipe the part or the parts concerned with cleaning cloths. Start the engine and raise the engine coolant temperature until the diesel fuel reaches 80 °C, 176 °F. Stop the engine and check for traces of grease on the part or parts concerned. If there are such signs, replace the part or parts concerned. Bleed the fuel circuit and continue the checks.

testgroup.question: Are there greasy marks on the priming pump? (Visual inspection and touch check)

action.ptxt: Check the assembly of the elements and the condition of the seal at the union of the two components, if the leak is at the seal. Replace the part or the parts concerned. Bleed the fuel circuit and continue the checks.

testgroup.question: Does the diesel filter offer up traces of grease? (Visual and tactile inspections)

action.ptxt: Check the assembly of the elements and the condition of the seal at the union of the two components, if the leak is at the seal. Replace the part or the parts concerned. Bleed the fuel circuit and continue the checks.

testgroup.question: Are there greasy marks on the return pipes?

action.ptxt: Check the assembly of the elements and the condition of the seal at the union of the two components, if the leak is at the seal. Replace the part or the parts concerned. Bleed the fuel circuit and continue the checks.

testgroup.question: Does the high pressure pump show traces of grease? (Visual and tactile inspections)
Do the high pressure pipes and the injector rail show traces of grease? (Visual and tactile inspections)
Do the injectors show traces of grease? (Visual and tactile inspections)
Does the leak appear on the union / joint?

action.ptxt: If the leak is on the component, replace this and the high pressure pipe(s) removed at the same time as the component.

If the leak is on the join of a high pressure pipe and the component, remove the high pressure pipe and perform a visual inspection of the unions: if you find damaged unions, change the defective component and the high pressure pipe(s) removed at the same time as the component.
